intro: Mananthes prachinburensis, commonly known as the Prachinburi mannanth, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
